term.name: vitalism
term.source: From Latin vitalis: relating to life or living things.
term.def: The belief (opposed to &materialism; and &determinism;) that human beings are not merely physical but contain a spiritual component or vital essence. In practice, vitalism involves a &dualism; of matter and life. Usually used in reference to certain views popular during the late nineteenth century in reaction against the rise of &darwinism;.
